noun.description: The state of feeling annoyed, impatient, or slightly angry.
examples: much to my irritation, Chris fell asleep

noun.description: Inflammation or other discomfort in a body part caused by reaction to an irritant substance.
examples: some chemicals cause a direct irritation to the skin leading to dermatitis

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin irritatio(n-), from the verb irritare (see irritate).
